item.title: 2.5D Locator - ZLOC Part 2
item.description: Let’s pick up from where we left off. We have used some fancy expressions to create an image plane. But if we tweak this expression just a little bit we can create a 2.5D Locator from scratch! First let’s edit the expression. Instead of manipulating the ScaleX and ScaleY attributes, pipe the same formula to the TranslateX and TranslateY attributes like this… [Before] pPlane1.

item.title: Poly Image Plane - ZLOC Part 1
item.description: An Image Plane is just a “Reflection” of a camera’s Film Back. We can figure out the Image Plane’s width and height by using some simple math. Lets make a Poly Image Plane by using this formula. First, create a camera. We will be using it’s default settings.
